answers.answer:
To join the new community gardening program in Galați, follow these steps:
First, visit the local park or contact the public relations department at the City Hall for more information about the program and its requirements.
Once you have all the necessary information, register by filling out an application form with your personal data, including name, address, phone number, and any other relevant information.
After submitting your application, attend a mandatory orientation session where you will learn about the basics of sustainable urban agriculture, composting techniques, and proper care of plants and crops.
Finally, complete an evaluation process that includes an interview with program officials to assess your commitment and interest in contributing to the local community through gardening activities.
answers.bResponse:
To join the new community gardening program in Galați, follow these steps:
First, visit the local park or contact the public relations department at the City Hall for more information about the program and its requirements.
Once you have all the necessary information, register by filling out an application form with your personal data, including name, address, phone number, and any other relevant information.
After submitting your application, attend a mandatory orientation session where you will learn about the basics of sustainable urban agriculture, composting techniques, and proper care of plants and crops.
Finally, complete an evaluation process that includes an interview with program officials to assess your commitment and interest in contributing to the local community through gardening activities. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-galati

answers.answer:
Here are some organizations and services that may be able to assist you with managing in a new city:

* The local government office (Prefectura or Primăria) - They can offer general guidance and advice about living in the area.
* Local tourist information center - They can provide maps, brochures, and other useful materials for visitors.
* International student support service - If you are an international student, they can provide specific help tailored to your needs.
* Libraries - Many libraries have resources available for people moving into the community, such as books and online databases.
* Community centers - These places often hold events and activities open to all members of the community.
* Social workers - They can offer professional advice and support if needed.

answers.answer:
According to the summary, the following organizations offer psychological support for refugees from Ukraine:

* Project HOPE provides psychological assistance in various languages, including Ukrainian, Russian, Romanian, and English, with consultations available at the "Sf. Apostol Andrei" County Emergency Clinical Hospital in Galați.
* Positive Progress Psychological Solutions offers consultations in multiple languages, targeting refugees from Ukraine, residents of Romania, and other groups such as children, LGBTIQ+ individuals, and the Roma community.
* Terre des hommes Foundation provides psychological assistance to several specific groups, including refugees from Ukraine, third-country nationals, local populations in Romania, pregnant or nursing mothers, and unaccompanied children.
* Save the Children offers psychological services in four languages, including Russian, Ukrainian, Romanian, and English, primarily focusing on communities affected by conflict situations.
* The International Organization for Migration (IOM) provides comprehensive care packages for vulnerable individuals seeking assistance in addressing their emotional needs, offering guidance in multiple languages, including Russian, Ukrainian, Romanian, and English.
* Plan International Organization delivers psychological services in different locations throughout Romania, catering specifically to adult and child refugees from Ukraine.
* Red Cross Romania provides extensive mental health consultations and psychological support to diverse groups
